definition: The Yellow Emperor's Internal Canon, medical text c. 300 BC
surname Huang or Hwang
yellow/pornographic/to fall through
emperor
inside/inner/internal/within/interior
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
surname Jing

sentences.english: As early as the "Huang Di Nei Jing" there are records.
sentences.chinese: 早在《黄帝内经》就有记载。

sentences.english: Huangdi Neijing (Huangdi's Classic on Medicine )laid the foundation for formation of the Tuinaology system.
sentences.chinese: 《黄帝内经》为按摩医学体系白勺形成奠定了基础。

sentences.english: The second section examines the concept "spirit" in the Huangdi Neijing.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分为《黄帝内经》中“神”范畴的研究。

sentences.english: Chinese medicine method and theory spring from Huangdi Emperor's Internal Classic.
sentences.chinese: 中医的方法与理论渊源于《黄帝内经》。

sentences.english: The understanding of fainting during acupuncture in Huangdi's Internal Classic was discussed.
sentences.chinese: 文章究其经文，探讨《黄帝内经》对晕针的认识。

sentences.english: The collateral and collateral disease theory is based on The Canon of Internal Medicine.
sentences.chinese: 络脉与络病学说奠基于《黄帝内经》。

sentences.english: Many contributions were credited to Huangdi.
sentences.chinese: 他的许多贡献都记入《黄帝内经》。

sentences.english: The second part is the wholly summary and analysis of Psychotherapy of TCM in endo-meridians.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分对《黄帝内经》心理疗法进行了总结分析。

definition: abbr. for 黃帝內經|黄帝内经[Huang2 di4 Nei4 jing1], The Yellow Emperor's Internal Canon, medical text c. 300 BC
the Divine Pivot or Spiritual Pivot, ancient Chinese medical text
traditional Chinese medicine/TCM
traditional Chinese medical science/a doctor trained in Chinese medicine
Prescriptions Worth a Thousand in Gold, early Tang compendium of herbal medicine by Sun Simiao 孫思邈|孙思邈[Sun1 Si1 miao3]
Shennong's Compendium of Materia Medica, a Han dynasty pharmacological compendium, 3 scrolls
The Book of Changes ("I Ching")
healer/physician/medical man/doctor (esp. of TCM)
hidden inner properties and their external manifestations (TCM)
the way of maintaining good health
Prescriptions Worth a Thousand in Gold, early Tang compendium of herbal medicine by Sun Simiao 孫思邈|孙思邈[Sun1 Si1 miao3]
pattern-syndrome identification based on the eight principles (TCM)
twelve channels of TCM
the Book of Dao by Laozi or Lao-Tze, the sacred text of Daoism
Compendium of Medical Herbs 1596, compiled by Li Shizhen 李時珍|李时珍[Li3 Shi2 zhen1]

Six Classics, namely: Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], Book of History 尚書|尚书[Shang4 shu1], Book of Rites 儀禮|仪礼[Yi2 li3], the lost Book of Music 樂經|乐经[Yue4 jing1], Book of Changes 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], Spring and Autumn Annals 春秋[Chun1 qiu1]
